repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First and Second series of
            Programmatic Labor Reform and Social Structural Adjustment
            Loans and a Third Labor Reform and Social Development Policy Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
This report describes the results of a
            series of three projects in the Republic of Colombia: First
            Programmatic Labor Reform and Social Structural Adjustment
            Loan (PLaRSSAL I), Second Programmatic Labor Reform and
            Social Structural Adjustment Loan (PLaRSSAL II), and the
            Third Labor Reform and Social Development Policy Loan
            (LaRSDPL III); together comprising a programmatic lending
            operation spanning the four years of the first Uribe
            administration. The overall outcome of these three projects
            is rated satisfactory, and the performance of the Bank and
            the Borrower is also rated as satisfactory. Lessons learned:
            constant engagement with the client is important via a rich
            technical dialogue and varied portfolio. The multi-sectoral
            PLaRSSAL program team worked with the Government of Colombia
            (GoC) in a wide range of lending and non-lending activities,
            which facilitated the preparation of the program in two key
            ways. First, the GoC and Bank teams developed a good working
            relationship over many years. Second, the Bank team, through
            this continued relationship was well versed in the
            objectives, strategies, results-management, and outputs of
            the social sectors, allowing for a greater focus on strategy
            and implementation in the development of the program. A
            commitment by the clients to implement a well-designed
            Government program. The national development plan defined
            each social institution's strategic objectives for the
            Uribe administration, thereby providing a base upon which to
            design the Bank's program. The social institutions were
            committed to implementing the strategies and meeting the
            quantifiable targets and saw the value added of Bank support
            in the design, implementation, and evaluation of the strategy.

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First Programmatic Labor Reform
            and Social Structural Adjustment Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Structural
            Adjustment Project for Colombia were as follows: the outcome
            was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            experience of Programmatic Labor Reform and Social
            Structural Adjustment Loan (PLaRSSAL I) implies the
            following main lessons that have been considered in the
            preparation of the PLaRSSAL II: Strong and sustained
            dialogue between the Government of Colombia (GOC) and the
            Bank through joint high-quality sector work on social
            protection issues and operations is valuable for future
            operations. Emphasis on outputs and outcomes, rather than
            inputs and processes, facilitates monitoring and following
            up of conditions by both the Government and the Bank. A
            series of operations - SECAL, PLaRSSAL I, and PLaRSSAL II -
            commits the Government to stay focused on monitoring
            progress in outputs of key reform measures over a longer
            time period in a coordinated, formal and systematic way.
            While the institutional reform is underway, constant
            collaboration between the GOC, the Bank, and other partners
            is crucial to developing the new platform upon which the
            health, education, and social reforms will rest.

5087379.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Human development

repnme.cdata!:
Colombia - First Programmatic Labor Reform
            and Social Structural Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Programmatic Labor Reform and
            Social Structural Adjustment Loan supports the general
            government objective of promoting higher employment,
            increased human capital formation, and strengthened social
            protection, especially of the poor and vulnerable. This
            objective would be achieved through more efficient and
            equitable use of social sector resources, improved
            regulatory environment and better institutional practices.
            Following are the project objectives: A) Institution of an
            effective authority in charge of developing a comprehensive
            social risk management system to provide efficient and
            timely protection of the poor and vulnerable against the
            threats and consequences of illness, unemployment, poverty,
            and economic volatility. B) Greater access of poor children
            to ICBF Assistance and Prevention programs through the
            establishment of an explicit targeting policy and practices
            to ensure their cost-effectiveness. C) Achievement of at
            least 95 percent Expanded Program of Immunization (PAI)
            coverage rate of 0-5 year old children by 2006. D) More
            advances in the implementation of health system reform,
            further expanding health insurance coverage of the poor,
            reducing direct subsidy to public hospitals, and ensuring
            quality of services of health insurers and care providers.
